title: Introducing: Grapell
content:
Stockholm trio Grapell, consisting of Emil Erstrand, Joakim Wolfert and Nils Nygårdh, released their intoxicating three track debut EP on Strangers Candy last month.

Let’s not beat around the bush here, there’s more than a touch of Radiohead to the group, in fact, White Fox In The Snow is more Thom Yorke than King of Limbs was, and arguably better. With lines like ‘A little kiss behind the pole / A white fox in the snow / When someone held a weapon to your throat / Then I knew what to do‘, lyrically it’s rather despairing at points, yet with an undercurrent of uplifting optimism. Of the three tracks, EP closer Fire Between is the standout, a compelling love song that’s elegantly rounded and assured.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
